posts.post_content:
I love how the weakest-costed midrange creatures tend to have flavor text that sounds like braggadocio but carries an undercurrent of self-mockery.  
  
Case in point: "fools and fuels are one and the same" sounds badass, until you tap down your four Mountains and realize *you're the one fueling this guy.*
posts.html:
I love how the weakest-costed midrange creatures tend to have flavor text that sounds like braggadocio but carries an undercurrent of self-mockery.

Case in point: "fools and fuels are one and the same" sounds badass, until you tap down your four Mountains and realize you're the one fueling this guy.

Posted By: Hoonster (3/6/2011 5:37:49 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
0.5/5, Why you ask?  
  
For 4 mana, I can have [Skizzik](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Skizzik), [Avalanche Riders](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avalanche Riders) or [Flametongue Kavu](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flametongue Kavu), all of which have useful abilities and Riders have the same echo cost  
  
For 1 more mana, I can keep Skizzik in play or use [Savage Firecat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Savage Firecat), which is bigger and has trample  
  
This silly thing doesn't even have haste or trample, fail WotC FAIL!
